meanings.definition: Resembling a shed in appearance or structure.
meanings.sent1: The small shedlike building stood at the edge of the field.
meanings.sent2: The shedlike roof was made of old, weathered wood.
meanings.sent3: The shedlike structure provided shelter for the animals during the storm.
meanings.sent4: The shedlike structure loomed in the distance, blending into the landscape.
meanings.sent5: The shedlike appearance of the house gave it a rustic charm.

meanings.definition: To cast off or let fall, as leaves.
meanings.sent1: In autumn, the trees shedlike their colorful leaves.
meanings.sent2: The maple tree shedlike its leaves in preparation for winter.
meanings.sent3: The trees seemed to shedlike their leaves all at once, creating a colorful carpet on the ground.
meanings.sent4: As the wind picked up, the trees began to shedlike their leaves in a graceful dance.
meanings.sent5: The gentle breeze caused the trees to shedlike their leaves, creating a beautiful cascade of colors.

meanings.definition: To get rid of or discard.
meanings.sent1: She decided to shedlike her old clothes and donate them to charity.
meanings.sent2: It was time to shedlike the unnecessary clutter from the garage.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly said he needed to shedlike some weight after the holiday feasting.
meanings.sent4: The company had to shedlike some of its employees due to budget cuts.
meanings.sent5: The decision to shedlike the outdated technology was met with relief by the team.
